result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Earl Robert Addington

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/27/22 sp)
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 10/24/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing set for September 19th - unable to forward - return to sender.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:05 PM Defendant Charles Earl Robert Addington in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Charles Earl Robert Addington.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pretrial Conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:08 PM Defendant Charles Earl Robert Addington appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Charles Earl Robert Addington.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 09/06/22 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
If released, Participate in the Portage County Day Report Program and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

1:26 PM Defendant Charles E Addington appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI. 

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession with Intent Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine, Possession with Intent to Manufacture/Deliver THC and Possession of Schedule I & II Narcotics.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is informed to hire his own attorney or petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant makes statements. 

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 
Defendant is on a PO hold.

Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
